notes: 1. (12+3) awarded following completion of secondary school = completion of three years (XY semester credit hours) of undergraduate study of (LEVEL + SUBJECT) education
A/R = 12 years of elementary-secondary education
LOP = 3 years beyond completion of 12 years of elementary-secondary education
2. (12+2) awarded following a Proficiency Certificate in Education = associate's degree in (LEVEL/special) education with a concentration in (SUBJECT)
A/R = Proficiency Certificate in Education
LOP = 2 years beyond a Proficiency Certificate in Education
3. (2+1) awarded following a 2-year bachelor's degree = completion of one year (XY semester credit hours) of undergraduate study of (LEVEL + SUBJECT) education

LOP = 1 year beyond a 2-year bachelor's degree
4. (3+1) awarded following a 3-year bachelor's degree = bachelor's degree in (LEVEL/special) education with a concentration in (SUBJECT)

credentialName: Título de Contador Privado
admissionRequirements: Completion of 6 years of elementary education
programLength: Varies
notes: A/R = Completion of 6 years of elementary education
LOP = Varies
POS = field of study
EQUIVALAENCY: Título de Contador/a Privado/a =
if 2 or 3 years in length = Completion of 8th OR 9th grade at an accredited vocational senior high school (depending on the program length)
If shorter = Completion of secondary level technical training

This program is part of commercial training. Programs of commercial study vary in length from a few months to four years; however, most last three years. Programs are offered at the lower-secondary level, referred to in Mexico as: nivel medio basico, nivel medio elemental or nivel medio terminal, and generally lead to one of the following diplomas:
auxiliar contable (bookkeeping assistant),
contadoradministrativo (administrative bookkeeper),
contador privado (private bookkeeper),
estenografo (stenographer)
secretaria (secretary)
secretaria administrative (administrative secretary)
secretaria bilingue (bilingual secretary), and
secretaria ejecutiva (executive secretary)"

credentialName: Carta de Pasante
notes: PLEASE LOOK CLOSELY AT THE DOCUMENTS
FOR SECONDARY STUDY: Carta de Pasante = senior high school diploma or vocational senior high school diploma (review coursework)

POS = field of study
FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDY: Carta de Pasante = X years/semesters/semester credit hours of undergraduate study
A/R = secondary school completion

FOR GRADUATE STUDY: Carta de Pasante = X years/semesters/semester credit hours of graduate study
A/R = Título de Licenciado or a qualifying first degree
LOP = 2 years beyond a qualifying first degree
At undergraduate and graduate level, Cartas de Pasante are issued upon completion of required coursework, but before qualifying for the award. A Carta de Pasanta does not denote degree award.

credentialName: Grading scale is based on 0 - 10 with 6.0 as the minimum passing grade:  9.0 - 10 = 4.00/A, 8.0 - 8.9 = 3.33/B+, 7.0 - 7.9 = 2.67/B-, 6.0 - 6.9 = 2.00/C, 0.0 - 5.9 = 0.00/F
Grading scale is based on 0.0 - 10 with 7.0 as the minimum passing grade:  9.0 - 10 = 4.00/A, 8.0 - 8.9 = 3.00/B, 7.0 - 7.9 = 2.00/C, 0.0 - 6.9 = 0.00/F
Grading scale is based on 0 - 10 with 8 as the minimum passing grade:  10 = 4.00/A, 9 = 3.00/B, 8 = 2.00/C, 0 - 7 = 0.00/F
Grading scale is based on 0 - 100 with 60 as the minimum passing grade: 90 - 100 = 4.00/A, 80 - 89 = 3.33/B+, 70 - 79 = 2.67/B-, 60 - 69 = 2.00/C, 0 - 59 = 0.00/F
Grading scale is based on 0 - 100 with 70 as the minimum passing grade:  90 - 100 = 4.00/A, 80 - 89 = 3.00/B, 70 - 79 = 2.00/C, 0 - 69 = 0.00/F
The grade scale is based on 100 with 80 as the minimum passing grade: 95 - 100 = 4.00/A, 90 - 94 = 3.33/B+, 85 - 89 = 3.00/B, 80 - 84 = 2.00/C, 10-79 = 0.00/F

The grades are converted as follow: 10 (excelente / excellent) = 4.00/A, 9 (muy bien / very good) = 4.00/A,  8 (bien / good) = 3.33/B+, 7 (regular) = 2.67/B-, 6 (suficiente / sufficient) = 2.00/C, and below 6 (no suficiente / insufficient) = 0.00/F.

credentialName: Universidad Pedagógica Nacional, Unidad 11, Aguascalientes
notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools.
Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentration (equivalent to two semesters).
UPN also offers graduate education.

credentialName: CONALEP
programLength: five- to six-semester
notes: CONALEP refers to the Colegio Nacional de Educación Profesional Técnica / National School of Professional Technical Education which was established in México in 1978 by Presidential Decree.

The goal of CONALEP is to enable upper-secondary level students to acquire the vocational skills needed for direct entry in the employment sector rather than to prepare them for higher education; accordingly, CONALEP is able to adjust institutional curriculum to fit local business and industry.

Students complete a five- to six-semester program of study, with approximately 60% devoted to hands-on activities, leading to the upper-secondary qualification of profesional técnico / technical professional which in Mexico belongs to the nivel medio superior / upper-secondary level.
The academic requirement for admission into CONALEP programs is Mexican secundaria or lower-secondary education, that is, to the seventh, eighth, and ninth grades.

credentialName: Universidad Interamericana del Norte, Campus Tijuana
englishName: (Interamerican University of the North Tijuana Campus)
notes: The Inter-American University of the North (full name is Universidad Interamericana del Norte y Tecnológico Sierra Madre / Inter-American University of the North and Sierra Madre Technological Institute) is a multicampus university system across Mexico.

The UIN system offers preparatoria / upper-secondary, licenciatura / licentiate, maestría / master's and doctorado / doctorate degree programs in such fields as ciencias naturales y exactas / exact and natural sciences, educación y humanidades / humanities and teacher training, ciencias agropecuarias / land and cattle sciences, ciencias de la salud / health sciences, ingenierías / engineering, ciencias sociales / social sciences, and ciencias administrativas / administrative sciences.

There are 16 campuses: Cd. Chihuahua, Cd. Juárez, Monterrey, Saltillo, Torreón, Tampico, Reynosa, San Luis Potosí, Culiacán, Tijuana, Cd. del Carmen, Mazatlán, Querétaro, Mérida, Villa Hermosa, and Campeche.
The grade scale is based on 5 to10 with 6 as passing:  9-10 = 4.00 / A, 8 = 3.33 / B +, 7 = 2.67 / B-, 6 = 2.00 / C, 5.9-0 = 0.00 / F.
The academic year is comprised of tetramestres / 4-month terms; transfer policies are liberal.

Escuela Superior de Danza Folklórica Mexicana, AC
englishName: (Higher School of Mexican Folkloric Dance, A.C.)
notes: Escuela Superior de Danza Folklórica Mexicana / Higher School of Mexican Folkloric Dance, located in Chihuahua City, Chihuahua State, is a private institution founded in 1960 to promote Mexican regional dance.
The ESDFM offers three programs, two of which are academic.

At the undergraduate level, the eight-semester Licenciatura en Danza Folklórica Mexicana / Licentiate in Mexican Folkloric Dance holds Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Official Recognition by means of Secretaría de Educación Pública / Secretariat of Public Education agreement number 21MSU1116I of 1999; admission to the licentiate program requires prior completion of bachillerato / upper-secondary education.

At the upper-secondary level, the five-summer Título de Técnico Profesional Folklorista en Danza / Title of Professional Folkloric Technician in Dance likewise holds Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Official Recognition by means of Secretaría de Educación Pública / Secretariat of Public Education agreement; admission to the technician program requires prior completion of secundaria / lower-secondary education.

Completion of both programs culminates in a carta de pasante / attestation of completion of study plan; upon passing the examen recepcional / graduation examination, the student is issued his título de técnico (at the upper-secondary level) or título de licenciado (at the undergraduate level), both of which qualify for a cédula / degree registration card which functions in Mexico as licensure at the corresponding educational level.
In addition to its two academic programs, the ESDFM offers the Curso de Actualización / Updating Program, one month in length, four hours per day.
The Curso de Actualización is a skills-based program which provides enrichment / further education in Mexican Folkloric Dance.
Admission does not require a specific Mexican benchmark credential; accordingly, the Curso de Actualización equates to non-credit bearing continuing education in the U.S.

credentialName: Universidad Interamericana del Norte
notes: The Inter-American University of the North (full name is Universidad Interamericana del Norte y Tecnológico Sierra Madre / Inter-American University of the North and Sierra Madre Technological Institute) is a multicampus university system across Mexico.

The UIN system offers preparatoria / upper-secondary, licenciatura / licentiate, maestría / master's and doctorado / doctorate degree programs in such fields as ciencias naturales y exactas / exact and natural sciences, educación y humanidades / humanities and teacher training, ciencias agropecuarias / land and cattle sciences, ciencias de la salud / health sciences, ingenierías / engineering, ciencias sociales / social sciences, and ciencias administrativas / administrative sciences.

There are 16 campuses: Cd. Chihuahua, Cd. Juárez, Monterrey, Saltillo, Torreón, Tampico, Reynosa, San Luis Potosí, Culiacán, Tijuana, Cd. del Carmen, Mazatlán, Querétaro, Mérida, Villa Hermosa, and Campeche.
The academic year is comprised of tetramestres / 4-month terms; transfer policies are liberal.

credentialName: Universidad Pedagógica Nacional, Unidad 81, Chihuahua
notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools.
Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters).
UPN also offers graduate education.

credentialName: Universidad Interamericana del Norte, Campus Saltillo
notes: The Inter-American University of the North (full name is Universidad Interamericana del Norte y Tecnológico Sierra Madre / Inter-American University of the North and Sierra Madre Technological Institute) is a multicampus university system across Mexico.

The UIN system offers preparatoria / upper-secondary, licenciatura / licentiate, maestría / master's and doctorado / doctorate degree programs in such fields as ciencias naturales y exactas / exact and natural sciences, educación y humanidades / humanities and teacher training, ciencias agropecuarias / land and cattle sciences, ciencias de la salud / health sciences, ingenierías / engineering, ciencias sociales / social sciences, and ciencias administrativas / administrative sciences.

There are 16 campuses: Cd. Chihuahua, Cd. Juárez, Monterrey, Saltillo, Torreón, Tampico, Reynosa, San Luis Potosí, Culiacán, Tijuana, Cd. del Carmen, Mazatlán, Querétaro, Mérida, Villa Hermosa, and Campeche.
The grade scale is based on 5 to10 with 6 as passing:  9-10 = 4.00 / A, 8 = 3.33 / B +, 7 = 2.67 / B-, 6 = 2.00 / C, 5.9-0 = 0.00 / F.
The academic year is comprised of tetramestres / 4-month terms; transfer policies are liberal.

credentialName: Universidad Pedagógica Nacional
notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools.
Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters).
UPN also offers graduate education.

englishName: National School of Professional Technical Education
programLength: five- to six-semester
notes: CONALEP refers to the Colegio Nacional de Educación Profesional Técnica / National School of Professional Technical Education which was established in México in 1978 by Presidential Decree.

The goal of CONALEP is to enable upper-secondary level students to acquire the vocational skills needed for direct entry in the employment sector rather than to prepare them for higher education; accordingly, CONALEP is able to adjust institutional curriculum to fit local business and industry.

Students complete a five- to six-semester program of study, with approximately 60% devoted to hands-on activities, leading to the upper-secondary qualification of profesional técnico / technical professional which in Mexico belongs to the nivel medio superior / upper-secondary level.
The academic requirement for admission into CONALEP programs is Mexican secundaria or lower-secondary education, that is, to the seventh, eighth, and ninth grades.

credentialName: Conservatorio Nacional de Música
admissionRequirements: prior completion of educación primaria / elementary education, plus an entrance examination
notes: Launched by Father Agustín Caballero in 1866 as the Conservatorio de Música de la Sociedad Filarmónica Mexicana / Music Conservatory of the Mexican Philharmonic Society, the current Conservatorio Nacional de Música de México / National Music Conservatory of Mexico is the principal provider of training in performing arts.
Thus, the CNMM has the unique role of preserving Mexican national culture within the context of performing arts.

The CNMM has given rise to such entities as the the Escuela Nacional de Música de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México / National Music School of the National Autonomous University of Mexico as well as the Escuela Nacional de Arte Teatral / the National School of Theater Arts and the Orquesta Sinfónica Nacional / National Symphonic Orchestra, both of the Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes / National Institute for Fine Arts.

In the areas of musical interpretation, teaching, creativity, and research, the conservatory currently offers three levels of skills-based study:  Nivel de iniciación o sector infantil / introductory level or early-childhood section, técnico profesional / professional technician, and (técnico) superior / higher technician.

credentialName: Escuela DIF de Enfermería, A.C.
admissionRequirements: upper-secondary Título de Enfermero / Title of Nurse and upper-secondary bachillerato
programLength: 3-term
issuingBody: Instituto Politécnico Nacional / National Polytechnic Institute of Mexico
notes: Escuela DIF (Desarrollo Integral de Familia) de Enfermería, A.C. / Integrated Family Development School of Nursing, located in Monterrey, Nuevo León, is a private tertiary institution with Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Legal Standing through the Instituto Politécnico Nacional / National Polytechnic Institute of Mexico, located in Mexico City, by means of Agreement Number 066/97, signed on 5-30-97 and published on 6-15-97.

Escuela DIF de Enfermería offers what in Mexico is usually called a curso complementario / complementary program for the Licenciatura de Enfermería / Licentiate in Nursing which is based on an IPN-approved degree plan.

This program is available to bearers of the upper-secondary Título de Enfermero / Title of Nurse (and similary-named upper-secondary credentials in nursing) who subsequently complete the upper-secondary bachillerato.

The premise of this program is that the acquisition of the upper-secondary bachillerato affords EDIFE the opportunity to recognize upper-secondary Título de Enfermero coursework as lower-level post-secondary coursework.

Accordingly, the bearer of the upper-secondary Título de Enfermero who subsequently completes the upper-secondary bachillerato may enroll in a short (3-term) curso complementario / complementary program leading to the Licenciatura en Enfermería / Licentiate in Nursing which normally requires 8 semesters of study beyond completion of upper-secondary education.
Upon earning this licentiate, the nursing graduate qualifies for the cédula / degree registration card which constitutes professional licensing in Mexico.
Thus, the Licenciatura en Enfermería equates to a U.S. Bachelor of Science in Nursing even though it yields some 45 semester credit hours.

notes: The Higher Institute of Ecclesiatic Studies, founded in 1967, is a bona fide private institution of post-secondary education linked to the Universidad Pontificia de Mexico / Pontifical University of Mexico.
Universidad Pontificia de México / Pontifical University of Mexico was founded in 1551 as the Pontifica y Real Universidad de México.
The first institutional phase lasted until 1867.
The second phase ran from 1869 to 1932.

The third phase began 6-29-1982 when the Sagrada Congregación para la Educación Católica / Sacred Congregation for Catholic Education created the Facultad de Teología / Faculty of Theology; said faculty was recognized by the Secretariat of Public Education on 2-19-98 by means of agreement 982027 and was authorized to confer the degree of Licenciatura en Teología / Licentiate in Theology.
UPM is recognized as a pontifical university by the Vatican.
AT UPM, the Diplomados Especializados (Teología Espiritual) / Specialized Diploma Programs in Spiritual Theology require three summers of 80 clock hours per summer.
Admission requires prior completion of the basic course of study in theology or two years of study in a Theological Institute.
Aside from immigration requirements, foreign students require approval of the general or area coordinator.
UPM cursos de verano / summer programs do not count toward degrees in the regular programs of study.

International Baccalaureate Organization
notes: According to its website, the International Baccalaureate Organization is a non-profit educational organization established in 1968.
The IBO has four regional offices:  IB North America (IBNA), New York; IB Latin America (IBLA), Buenos Aires; IB Africa, Europe and Middle East (IBAEM), Geneva; and IB Asia-Pacific (IBAP), Singapore.

The IBO offers three international programs:  Diploma Programme for students in the final two years of school before university; Middle Years Programme for students aged 11 to 16;  and Primary Years Programme for students aged 3 to 12.

Participating institutions are provided with detailed curriculum guidelines for each program and subject area; teacher training workshops; online access to education resources, subject area experts, and discussion sessions with teachers at IB schools throughout the world; external assessment of DP students' work; and procedures for school-based (internal) assessment of student work.
The Diploma Programme (DP)--a comprehensive two-year curriculum available in English, French and Spanish--provides a rigorous pre-university course culminating in examinations.
Many countries have a national policy regarding the acceptance / recognition of the IB diploma.
A list of U.S. institutions awarding advanced placement credit for qualifying examinations is posted on the IBO website.

Grading is based on a seven-point scale, with 1 and 2  as unacceptable; 3 as mediocre and generally not accepted in the U.S.; 4 as satisfactory and sometimes accepted in the U.S.; 5 as good and more widely accepted in the U.S.; and 6 and 7 as very good and excellent respectively and accepted at virtually all U.S. institutions which recognize IBO examinations.

Seminario Hispano de Santa Maria de Guadalupe
englishName: (Hispanic Seminary of Santa Maria of Guadalupe)
notes: Founded in 1999, the Seminario Hispano de Santa Maria de Guadalupe was a new initiative of the Cardinal Archbishop of Mexico City -- undertaken with the support of the Pontifical University of Mexico and the Seminario Conciliar (major seminary) of Mexico -- to educate Hispanic men living in the U.S. and Canada for priestly service.

This minor seminary was formed to respond to the needs of men currently living in the United States and Canada who -- though excellent candidates for the priesthood -- find themselves, because of language and differences in educational systems, at a disadvantage in attempting to enter North American seminaries.
They receive language training and an academic curriculum that prepares them to transition into major seminaries in the U.S. and Canada.

credentialName: Sociedad Mexicana de Análisis Existencial y Logoterapia, S.C.
englishName: (Mexican Existential Analysis and Speech Therapy Society)
notes: Founded in 1988, the Sociedad Mexicana de Análisis Existencial y Logoterapia / Mexican Society for Logotherapy and Existential Analysis is the first such institution in Mexico.
Logotherapy and Existential Analysis constitute the so-called  'Third Viennese School of Psychotherapy', was developed by Viktor Frankl and first published in 1938.
Logotherapy is defined as the method of psychotherapeutical treatment based on spiritual rather than psychological dimension.
The goal is to lead a person to self-determination based on self-responsibility.
According to the Viktor Frankl Institute website, logotherapy is the search for meaning as the primary human motivation.
Since persons are capable of deciding, they are also responsible for their decisions.
A human being is not a mere puppet of biological, hereditary and environmental forces but is always free to take a stand toward inner conditions and outer circumstances.

notes: The University of the Americas, Inc., was founded as Mexico City College in 1940.

It became a degree-granting institution in 1945, was renamed the University of the Americas in 1963, moved to Cholula (Puebla) in 1968, and changed its name to the the Fundación Universidad de las Américas-Puebla / University of the Americas at Puebla Foundation in 1985 at which time a campus at Mexico City was re-established.
Both campuses are accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, Fundación Universidad de las Américas-Puebla in 1959 and Universidad de las Américas-México in 1991.
Today, these are considered separate institutions.

Graduate:  Based on 10 with 7 as passing:  9-10 = 4.00/A, 8-8.9 = 3.00/B, 7-7.9 = 2.00/C, and below 7 = 0.00/F.
2.  Undergraduate: Based on 10 with 7 as passing: 9-10 = 4.00/A, 8-8.9 = 3.00/B, 7-7.9 = 2.00/C, below 7 = 0.00/F.

notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools.
Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters).
UPN also offers graduate education.

credentialName: Universidad Pontificia de México
notes: Universidad Pontificia de México / Pontifical University of Mexico was founded in 1551 as the Pontifica y Real Universidad de México.
The first institutional phase lasted until 1867.
The second phase ran from 1869 to 1932.

The third phase began 6-29-1982 when the Sagrada Congregación para la Educación Católica / Sacred Congregation for Catholic Education created the Facultad de Teología / Faculty of Theology; said faculty was recognized by the Secretariat of Public Education on 2-19-98 by means of agreement 982027 and was authorized to confer the degree of Licenciatura en Teología / Licentiate in Theology.
UPM is recognized as a pontifical university by the Vatican.

credentialName: Universidad Pontificia de México, Special Programs
admissionRequirements: prior completion of the basic course of study in theology or two years of study in a Theological Institute
notes: Universidad Pontificia de México / Pontifical University of Mexico was founded in 1551 as the Pontifica y Real Universidad de México.
The first institutional phase lasted until 1867.
The second phase ran from 1869 to 1932.

The third phase began 6-29-1982 when the Sagrada Congregación para la Educación Católica / Sacred Congregation for Catholic Education created the Facultad de Teología / Faculty of Theology; said faculty was recognized by the Secretariat of Public Education on 2-19-98 by means of agreement 982027 and was authorized to confer the degree of Licenciatura en Teología / Licentiate in Theology.
UPM is recognized as a pontifical university by the Vatican.
AT UPM, the Diplomados Especializados (Teología Espiritual) / Specialized Diploma Programs in Spiritual Theology require three summers of 80 clock hours per summer.
Admission requires prior completion of the basic course of study in theology or two years of study in a Theological Institute.
Aside from immigration requirements, foreign students require approval of the general or area coordinator.
UPM cursos de verano / summer programs do not count toward degrees in the regular programs of study.

credentialName: Seminario Diocesano de la Inmaculada Concepción
notes: Immaculate Conception Diocese Seminary was founded in 1974.
The Seminary is recognized as a religious institution for its theological studies but is not granted academic accreditation by the Public Education Secretariat in Mexico.

On 4-22-08, SpanTran spoke to Ms. Lucía Pintor / Academic Secretary, who stated the following:  The Seminary offers upper-secondary and tertiary education for philosophy, both with study plans and degrees accredited by the Secretaría de Educación Pública / Public Education Secretariat; the Seminary also offers theology studies, which are not accredited by said Mexican Secretariat.
Ms. Pintor further stated that the current rector requests a Mexican licenciatura / licentiate in philosophy for admission to the theological studies program.
Rather than academic decision, based on policies of enrollment services, the admission  requirements are decided by the prevailing rector.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters).

notes: Created in 1966, the Centro Regional de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CeRETI), Guadalajara, Jalisco State, began offering technical education, leading to the designation of técnico / technician (in construction, electrical engineering, electronics, and mechanics) based on a UNESCO educational model.
In 1971, the Técnico Laboratorista Químico en Celulosa y Papel / Chemical Laborabory Technician in Paper and Cellulose was added.
In 1977-76, the term Técnico / Technician was changed to Tecnólogo / Technologist, distinguishing between general secondary and upper-secondary education.
In 1978, tertiary level degrees in industrial engineering were added with majors in instrumentation and process control, mechanics, and paper and pulp.

In 1983, the CeNETI CeRETI system was dissolved; the former center in Jalisco became the Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CETI) ./ Center for Industrial Technical Education as an Organismo Público Descentralizado Federal / Decentralized Public Federal Institution.
The grade scale is based on 100, with 70 as the minimum passing grade:  90-100 = 4.00/A, 80-89 = 3.00/B, 70-79 = 2.00/C, and below 70 = 0.00/F.

notes: Founded in 1935, the Autonomous University of Guadalajara in Jalisco State is the oldest private university in Mexico.

credentialName: Universidad Autónoma de Guadalajara (Diplomado)
programLength: three years
notes: Founded in 1935, the Autonomous University of Guadalajara in Jalisco State is the oldest private university in Mexico.
Previously, it derived its validez oficial / accreditation through UNAM, the National Autonomous University of Mexico; currently, it is accredited through the Secretariat of Public Education.
UAG offered a flexible two-stage program in language teaching and linguistics.

The first stage comprised the Diplomado en la Enseñanza de Idiomas / Diplomate in the Teaching of Languages program which required three years of full-time study; the second stage comprised the Maestría en Lingüística / Title of Master in Linguistics which required one year.
UAG has confirmed to SpanTran Educational Services, Inc.,  that this combined program achieves the equivalent of a licenciatura / licentiate in Mexico.

credentialName: Universidad Autónoma de Guadalajara (Medical Students)
notes: Founded in 1935, the Autonomous University of Guadalajara in Jalisco State is the oldest private university in Mexico.
Previously, it derived its validez oficial / accreditation through UNAM, the National Autonomous University of Mexico; currently, it is accredited through the Secretariat of Public Education.
In addition to its medical program for Mexican nationals, UAG offers a special medical program for foreigners, with the first 4 semesters in English and the remaining 4 in Spanish.
In order to graduate, the medical student, whether Mexican or foreign, must serve his servicio social / community service and must pass his examen profesional / degree examination.

Mexican citizens are issued a cédula / degree registration card once their degrees are registered with the Secretaría de Educación Pública / Secretariat of Public Education; non-Mexican residents are not issued a cédula without which they cannot practice medicine.

notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters).

credentialName: Universidad Pedagógica Nacional, Unidad 171, Cuernavaca
notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools.
Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system.

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level:  formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies  (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters).
UPN also offers graduate education.

They hold Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Accreditation through the Secretariat of Public Education.
Admission requires prior completion of educación media superior / higher secondary education (bachillerato).
Programs require 2 years and culminate in the título de Técnico Superior Universitario / title of Higher University Technician.
The grade scale is based on 10 with 7 as passing:  9-10 = 4.00/A, 8-8.9 = 3.00/B, 7-7.9 = 2.00/C, below 7 = 0.00/F.

credentialName: Universidad Cristiana de las Américas
notes: Documentation from Universidad Cristiana de las Américas / Christian University of the Americas, located in Ciudad Guadalupe, Nuevo León State, Mexico, indicates that the institution holds Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Recognition of Official Validity of Studies through Northland Baptist College in Wisconsin.
According to the Council for Higher Education Accreditation / CHEA, Northland Baptist College is not the name of any accredited institution in the United States.
CHEA indicates that Northland Baptist Bible College, located in Dunbar, Wisconsin, is accredited by the Transnational Association of Christian Colleges and Schools.

Although TRACS is a bona fide accreditor, recognized by both CHEA and the U.S. Department of Education, it is not one of the six U.S. regional accreditors and does not replace the North Central Association of Colleges and Schools which is the regional accreditor for Wisconsin institutions.

Recognition by or an articulation with an individual institution in the United States in no way equates to Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios in Mexico nor does it imply regional accreditation in the U.S.
It is therefore the judgment of SpanTran Educational Services, Inc., that Universidad Cristiana de las Américas lacks accreditation in both Mexico and the United States.

notes: Accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools since 1959, see under Fundación Universidad de las Américas-Puebla in https://sacscoc.org/app/uploads/2019/11/Institutionswebmemlist.pdf

The RVOE in Mexico for certain programs was revoked (the inst didnt seek renewal, most likely because of other recognitions) https://www.sirvoes.sep.gob.mx/sirvoes/mvc/consultas# https://www.udlap.mx/ofertaacademica/mapaoferta.aspx
The University of the Americas, Inc., was founded as Mexico City College in 1940

It became a degree-granting institution in 1945, was renamed the University of the Americas in 1963, moved to Cholula (Puebla) in 1968, and changed its name to the the Fundación Universidad de las Américas-Puebla / University of the Americas at Puebla Foundation in 1985 at which time a campus at Mexico City was re-established
Both campuses are accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools, Fundación Universidad de las Américas-Puebla in 1959 and Universidad de las Américas-México in 1991
Today, these are considered separate institutions
Founded as an English-speaking institution, today at the University of the Americas in Puebla, Spanish is the predominant language
gradingInfo: Until 1977, the University of the Americas followed the quarter rather than semester system and the grade scale was based on the letter grades of A to F. Since Fall, 1977, the grading scale has been 0-10, with 7.5 as the minimum passing grade; in Fall, 1986, this grade scale was matched to Mexican alphabetic equivalencies, continuing with 7.5 / suficiente (sufficient) as the minimum passing grade. Grade conversions: 9-10 = 4.00 / A, 8-8.9 = 3.00 / B, 7.5-7.9 = 2.00 / C, below 7.5 = 0.00 / F

The UIN system offers preparatoria / upper-secondary, licenciatura / licentiate, maestría / master's and doctorado / doctorate degree programs in such fields as ciencias naturales y exactas / exact and natural sciences, educación y humanidades / humanities and teacher training, ciencias agropecuarias / land and cattle sciences, ciencias de la salud / health sciences, ingenierías / engineering, ciencias sociales / social sciences, and ciencias administrativas / administrative sciences

englishName: (Interamerican University of the North, Culiacan Campus)
issuingBody: Secretaría de Educación Pública y Cultura / Secretariat of Public Education and Culture of Sinaloa State
notes: The Inter-American University of the North (full name is Universidad Interamericana del Norte y Tecnológico Sierra Madre / Inter-American University of the North and Sierra Madre Technological Institute) is a multicampus university system across Mexico

The UIN system offers preparatoria / upper-secondary, licenciatura / licentiate, maestría / master's and doctorado / doctorate degree programs in such fields as ciencias naturales y exactas / exact and natural sciences, educación y humanidades / humanities and teacher training, ciencias agropecuarias / land and cattle sciences, ciencias de la salud / health sciences, ingenierías / engineering, ciencias sociales / social sciences, and ciencias administrativas / administrative sciences

There are 16 campuses: Cd. Chihuahua, Cd. Juárez, Monterrey, Saltillo, Torreón, Tampico, Reynosa, San Luis Potosí, Culiacán, Tijuana, Cd. del Carmen, Mazatlán, Querétaro, Mérida, Villa Hermosa, and Campeche
The academic year is comprised of tetramestres / 4-month terms; transfer policies are liberal

Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level: formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters)
UPN also offers graduate education

Previously, ENMT offered the 8-semester academic titles of ingeniero geógrafo naval / marine geographic engineer and ingeniero mecánico naval / marine mechanical engineer

Instituto de Ciencias y Estudios Superiores de Tamaulipas - Nursing
englishName: (Sciences and Higher Studies Institute of Tamaulipas - Nursing)
admissionRequirements: completion of upper-secondary education (Bachillerato) and upper-secondary Título de Enfermero
programLength: 3-term Curso Complementario
notes: Founded in 1979, the Institute of Sciences and Higher Studies of Tamaulipas / ICEST is a private institution with validez oficial / accreditation through the State of Tamaulipas
ICEST offers a special program called Curso Complementario de Licenciatura en Enfermería / Complementary Program for the Licentiate in Nursing

This program is available to bearers of the upper-secondary Título de Enfermero / Title of Nurse who also complete Bachillerato / Upper-Secondary Education or the dual Bachillerato Tecnológico en el área de Ciencias Químico-Biológicas en la carrera Enfermería General / Upper-Secondary Education, Biology and Chemistry Stream, with emphasis on General Nursing

The premise of this program is that the acquisition of the upper-secondary bachillerato affords ICEST the opportunity to recognize upper-secondary Título de Enfermero coursework as lower-level post-secondary coursework

Accordingly, the bearer of the upper-secondary Título de Enfermero may enroll in a short (3-term) Curso Complementario / Complementary Program leading to the Licenciatura en Enfermería / Licentiate in Nursing which normally requires 8 semesters of study beyond completion of upper-secondary education
Upon earning this licentiate, the nursing graduate qualifies for the cédula / degree registration card which constitutes professional licensing in Mexico
Thus, the Licenciatura en Enfermería equates to a U.S. Bachelor of Science in Nursing even though it yields some 45 semester credit hours
gradingInfo: The undergraduate grade scale is based on 10 with 6 as passing: 9-10 = 4.00/A, 8-8.9 = 3.33/B+, 7-7.9 = 2.67/B-, 6-6.9 = 2.00/C, 5.9-0 = 0.00 / F. The graduate grade scale is based on 10 with 8 as minimum acceptable grade: 9-10 = 4.00/A, 8-8.9 = 3.00/B.

Upon earning this licentiate, the nursing graduate qualifies for the cédula / degree registration card which constitutes professional licensing in Mexico
Thus, the Licenciatura en Enfermería equates to a U.S. Bachelor of Science in Nursing even though it yields some 45 semester credit hours

There are 16 campuses: Cd. Chihuahua, Cd. Juárez, Monterrey, Saltillo, Torreón, Tampico, Reynosa, San Luis Potosí, Culiacán, Tijuana, Cd. del Carmen, Mazatlán, Querétaro, Mérida, Villa Hermosa, and Campeche
The academic year is comprised of tetramestres / 4-month terms; transfer policies are liberal

englishName: (Technological Institute of the Sea in Boca del Rio [Number 1])

notes: The Institutos Tecnológicos del Mar / Technological Institutes of the Sea are accredited public institutions with Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Legal Standing through the Secretaría de Educación Pública / Secretariat of Public Education

Degrees include títulos de / titles of licenciado en administración de empresas marinas / licentiate in administration of marine businesses (8 semesters), ingeniero en alimentos marinos / marine food engineer (8 semesters), ingeniero en acuicultura / fish farming engineer (8 semesters), and ingeniero en pesca industrial / industrial fishing engineer (8 semesters)

issuingBody: Secretaría de Educación Pública / Secretariat of Public Education; Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México (UNAM) / National Autonomous University of Mexico; Escuela Nacional de Estudios Profesionales Acatlán / Acatlán National School of Professional Studies
notes: The University of Sotavento, located in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz State, has Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Legal Standing for the following licentiate / licentiate programs through the Secretaría de Educación Pública / Secretariat of Public Education: Administración / Administration, 2000; Ciencias de la Comunicación / Communication Sciences, 2000; Contaduría / Accounting, 2000; Derecho / Law, 2000; Ingeniería en Sistemas Computacionales / Computer Systems Engineering, 2000; Pedagogía / Education, 1999

In addition, the University of Sotavento has Reconocimiento de Validez Oficial de Estudios / Legal Standing for the following licentiate / licentiate programs through the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México (UNAM) / National Autonomous University of Mexico: Informática / Computer Information Systems, 1989; Pedagogía / Education, 1988; and Psicología / Psychology, 1989

The título de arquitecto / title of architect of the University of Sotavento has program incorporation through the Escuela Nacional de Estudios Profesionales Acatlán / Acatlán National School of Professional Studies, located in Acatlán, Estado de México, and part of the UNAM system

credentialName: Universidad Mexicana Plantel Veracruz
Universidad Pedagógica Nacional, Unidad 301, Xalapa
notes: The multicampus National Pedagógical University, headquartered in México City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools
Attendance is generally semi-escolarizada / open or non-traditional in the sistema de educación a distancia / distance education system

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level: formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters)
UPN also offers graduate education

credentialName: Universidad Interamericana del Norte, Campus Mérida
englishName: (Inter-American University of the North, Merida Campus)
notes: The Inter-American University of the North (full name is Universidad Interamericana del Norte y Tecnológico Sierra Madre / Inter-American University of the North and Sierra Madre Technological Institute) is a multicampus university system across Mexico

The UIN system offers preparatoria / upper-secondary, licenciatura / licentiate, maestría / master's and doctorado / doctorate degree programs in such fields as ciencias naturales y exactas / exact and natural sciences, educación y humanidades / humanities and teacher training, ciencias agropecuarias / land and cattle sciences, ciencias de la salud / health sciences, ingenierías / engineering, ciencias sociales / social sciences, and ciencias administrativas / administrative sciences

There are 16 campuses: Cd. Chihuahua, Cd. Juárez, Monterrey, Saltillo, Torreón, Tampico, Reynosa, San Luis Potosí, Culiacán, Tijuana, Cd. del Carmen, Mazatlán, Querétaro, Mérida, Villa Hermosa, and Campeche
The grade scale is based on 5 to10 with 6 as passing: 9-10 = 4.00 / A, 8 = 3.33 / B +, 7 = 2.67 / B-, 6 = 2.00 / C, 5.9-0 = 0.00 / F
The academic year is comprised of tetramestres / 4-month terms; transfer policies are liberal
gradingInfo: The grade scale is based on 5 to10 with 6 as passing: 9-10 = 4.00 / A, 8 = 3.33 / B +, 7 = 2.67 / B-, 6 = 2.00 / C, 5.9-0 = 0.00 / F

notes: The multicampus National Pedagogical University, headquartered in Mexico City, was founded in 1978 by presidential decree to offer university level training to working elementary and early-childhood teachers trained in normal schools

The plan de estudios / degree plan governs the curriculum which is three phased at the licentiate level: formación inicial / basic studies (equivalent to two semesters), formación profesional / professional studies (equivalent to four semesters), and concentración / concentración (equivalent to two semesters)
UPN also offers graduate education

credentialName: Centro Regional de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CeRETI)
issuingBody: Organismo Público Descentralizado Federal / Decentralized Public Federal Institution (as CETI)
notes: Created in 1966, the Centro Regional de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CeRETI), Guadalajara, Jalisco State, began offering technical education, leading to the designation of técnico / technician (in construction, electrical engineering, electronics, and mechanics) based on a UNESCO educational model.
In 1971, the Técnico Laboratorista Químico en Celulosa y Papel / Chemical Laborabory Technician in Paper and Cellulose was added.
In 1977-76, the term Técnico / Technician was changed to Tecnólogo / Technologist, distinguishing between general secondary and upper-secondary education.
In 1978, tertiary level degrees in industrial engineering were added with majors in instrumentation and process control, mechanics, and paper and pulp.

In 1983, the CeNETI CeRETI system was dissolved; the former center in Jalisco became the Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CETI) ./ Center for Industrial Technical Education as an Organismo Público Descentralizado Federal / Decentralized Public Federal Institution.
gradingInfo: The grade scale is based on 100, with 70 as the minimum passing grade: 90-100 = 4.00/A, 80-89 = 3.00/B, 70-79 = 2.00/C, and below 70 = 0.00/F.

credentialName: Centro Nacional de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CeNETI)
issuingBody: Organismo Público Descentralizado Federal / Decentralized Public Federal Institution (as CETI)
notes: Created in 1966, the Centro Regional de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CeRETI), Guadalajara, Jalisco State, began offering technical education, leading to the designation of técnico / technician (in construction, electrical engineering, electronics, and mechanics) based on a UNESCO educational model.
In 1971, the Técnico Laboratorista Químico en Celulosa y Papel / Chemical Laborabory Technician in Paper and Cellulose was added.
In 1977-76, the term Técnico / Technician was changed to Tecnólogo / Technologist, distinguishing between general secondary and upper-secondary education.
In 1978, tertiary level degrees in industrial engineering were added with majors in instrumentation and process control, mechanics, and paper and pulp.

In 1983, the CeNETI CeRETI system was dissolved; the former center in Jalisco became the Centro de Enseñanza Técnica Industrial (CETI) ./ Center for Industrial Technical Education as an Organismo Público Descentralizado Federal / Decentralized Public Federal Institution.
gradingInfo: The grade scale is based on 100, with 70 as the minimum passing grade: 90-100 = 4.00/A, 80-89 = 3.00/B, 70-79 = 2.00/C, and below 70 = 0.00/F.

credentialName: Universidad de Salud Natural Chapingo
notes: AS OF 7/1/24: FAKE INSTITUTION PLEASE CANCEL IF YOU SEE IT
BE CAREFUL WITH THIS INSTITUTION.
They were unrecognized and might have been shut down, definitely not worth of being called a university.
However, as far as I can see, they were only offering 'diplomado' and 'cursos' training courses.
No entry reqs.
They do seem to have been offering the training, so DW recs professional training for these.
https://unisanachapingo.com/producto/diploma-sep/
HOWEVER, they also seem to have been selling 'Diplomas SEP' which is hugely problematic/illegal.
If you see SEP docs from this institution, notify DW or another senior and/or JG.
https://unisanachapingo.com/producto/diploma-sep/

credentialName: The Anglo Mexican Foundation
notes: The history of The Anglo Mexican Foundation dates back to 1943 with the creation of the INSTITUTO ANGLO MEXICANO DE CULTURA, the objective being to strengthen ties between Great Britain and Mexico through on-going cultural exchange.

It is a private, non-university, non-degree granting academy of language and culture / civilization for teaching of the English language, the training of English teachers and the organization of a wide range of cultural events.
In 2003, the Institute changed its name to The Anglo Mexican Foundation in order to reflect the wide range of activities which the organization seeks to achieve in this new century.

credentialName: Escena Escuela de Animación y Arte Digital
englishName: (Escena School of Animation and Digital Art)
notes: Private HEI with programs recognized by SEP.
Program recognition needs to be checked on a case-by-case basis.
It currently (2025) has 2 recognized programs beginning from 2018-2022 with 2 program formats each, all licenciaturas:
Modelado y Animacion 3D (Escolarizado, Mixto)
Ilustracion (Escolarizado, Mixto)
Institution has existed since 2010, possibly under different names.
Past programs should be checked on a case-by-case basis.
https://escena.edu.mx/
